      • createSocket

        public Socket createSocket(String host,
                  int port,
                  InetAddress localAddress,
                  int localPort,
                  org.apache.commons.httpclient.params.HttpConnectionParams params)
                    throws IOException,
                           UnknownHostException,
                           org.apache.commons.httpclient.ConnectTimeoutException
        Attempts to get a new socket connection to the given host within the given time limit.
        Specified by:
        createSocket in interface org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.ProtocolSocketFactory
        Parameters:
        host - the host name/IP
        port - the port on the host
        localAddress - the local host name/IP to bind the socket to
        localPort - the port on the local machine
        params - Http connection parameters
        Returns:
        Socket a new socket
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the socket
        UnknownHostException - if the IP address of the host cannot be determined
        org.apache.commons.httpclient.ConnectTimeoutException

      • createTunnelServerSocket

        public Socket createTunnelServerSocket(String targethost,
                              Socket socket)
                                throws IOException
        Create a SSLsocket using an existing connected socket. It can be used such as a tunneled SSL proxy socket (eg when a CONNECT request is received). This SSLSocket will start server side handshake immediately.
        Parameters:
        targethost - the host where you want to connect to
        socket -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException
